ads, attention to detail, customer service, data base, inventory, office, presentations, quality control, sales, phones

<JD_START>
Job Title: Sales Manager - Southwest 

Location: California, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Customer Service, Sales

Description:
Glanbia Nutritionals is a science-led, innovative producer of dairy and non-dairy solutions, including cheese, nutritional and functional nutrition solutions and flavor solutions. Our US cheese business is the #1 provider of American-style cheddar cheese. We are the ingredient partner of choice to global customers in the food, beverage and nutrition industry. 
We are hiring a Sales Manager, Southwest who will be responsible for the sales and relationship management of strategic customers within the Southwest market of the USA; most of the customers are located in Southern California and Arizona. 

Responsibilities of the Sales Manager, Southwest include:Assist in the identification, development and execution of market opportunities to increase sales and distribution of the company’s portfolioCoordinate all aspects of customer care from original order with customer service to order shipment and ensuring or managing any issue that may arisePrepare sales quotes, negotiate pricing and provide business solutions to effectively close salesPresent and deliver sales programs, custom solutions and answer questions related to pricing, product knowledge and availabilityInterface with customers to resolve collection issuesTravel to customers for face-to-face meetings to promote new products, enhance customer relationship, address any product queries and ensure we are selling all materials and services we can offerTrack monthly sales & profit to ensure that no business is lost due to competitive pricing, availability, lead times or any other problems encountered by our customers with relation to dealing with Glanbia IngredientsForecast business for all categories to the best of your knowledge in JDA forecasting systemHunt and develop new business; follow through on all leads via phone, email or personal visitsStay current with latest industry news and trends by involvement in industry events, tradeshows, social outings, seminars, memberships in industry organizations and magazine subscriptionsShare knowledge gained regarding competition, leads, product development and potential new opportunitiesActively participate in the development, coordination and execution of the Company’s sales strategy; while also identifying strategic partnering opportunities with appropriate customers and suppliers
 Experience:Bachelor’s degree preferably Business Major/Sales & Marketing or Food Science5 years of progressive and proven sales experience, preferably in Premix solutions & specialty proteins or related industryProficient with MS Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint and SharePointAbility for domestic travel around 50%  We create functional and nutritional solutions to improve the quality, performance, nutritional value, texture and taste of many foods, beverages and supplements. We also make a significant amount of the world’s most popular cheese. The products we help to make are sold in over 130 countries, through private-label brands and major food and retail operations.    What we would like to offer you! The opportunity to develop your career on a global stage, continuous learning through an on-demand learning platform, and a competitive compensation package including staff discounts, generous family leave policy, health & dental plan, competitive salary, 401K.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
